spell.name: Rune of Detecting

m.text: incense and powdered precious metals worth at least 50 gp, which the spell consumes

entries: Wenn du diesen Zauber sprichst, schreibst du eine Rune auf eine Oberfläche (z.B. einen Tisch, einen Teil des Bodens oder der Wand) oder auf einen Gegenstand. Wenn du eine Fläche wählst, kann die Rune einen Bereich der Fläche mit einem Durchmesser von maximal 10 Fuß bedecken. Wenn du einen Gegenstand wählst, muss dieser Gegenstand an seinem Platz bleiben; wenn der Gegenstand mehr als 10 Fuß von der Stelle entfernt wird, an der du den Zauber gewirkt hast, verbrennt die Rune und der Zauber endet, ohne ausgelöst worden zu sein.

Du kannst die Rune in einem größeren Design verstecken, aber die Rune ist sichtbar und kann mit einer erfolgreichen Weisheitsprobe ({@skill Perception}) entdeckt werden. Mit einer erfolgreichen Intelligenzüberprüfung ({@skill Arcana}) kann eine Kreatur, die die Rune entdeckt, einen Teil davon auslöschen und den Zauber beenden, ohne ihn auszulösen. Der DC für diese beiden Überprüfungen ist der Schutz-DC deines Zaubers.

Du entscheidest, was die Rune auslöst, wenn du diesen Zauber sprichst. Bei Runen, die auf einer Oberfläche eingraviert sind, sind die typischsten Auslöser das Berühren oder Stehen auf der Rune, das Entfernen eines anderen Objekts, das die Rune verdeckt, das Annähern an die Rune in einer bestimmten Entfernung oder das Manipulieren des Objekts, auf dem die Rune eingraviert ist. Bei Glyphen, die auf einem Gegenstand eingraviert sind, gehören zu den häufigsten Auslösern die Annäherung an den Gegenstand in einer bestimmten Entfernung oder das Sehen oder Lesen der Rune.

Du kannst den Auslöser weiter verfeinern, so dass die Rune nur unter bestimmten Umständen oder in Abhängigkeit von körperlichen Merkmalen (wie Größe oder Gewicht), der Art der Kreatur (z. B. könnte der Schutz auf Aberrationen oder Drow wirken) oder der Ausrichtung aktiviert wird. Ihr könnt auch Bedingungen für Kreaturen festlegen, die die Rune nicht auslösen, z. B. für diejenigen, die ein bestimmtes Passwort sagen.

Wenn die Rune ausgelöst wird, erzeugt sie eine winzige {@condition invisible}, geistlose, formlose Kraft, die nur lange genug anhält, um mit einem mechanischen Element in der Nähe zu interagieren, z.B. mit einer Falle, einem Hebel oder einem Knopf. Das mechanische Element muss sich im Umkreis von 10 Fuß um die Rune befinden. Sobald die Kraft auf diese Weise interagiert, endet der Zauber und die Rune verblasst.

You love traps and you always have. The satisfaction when something comes together {@i just} right is a feeling you're very familiar with. You have always enjoyed tinkering with things and finding ways to defend your home or place of business with dangerous devices. You understand that traps can be, and often are, harmful but you treat your profession with some degree of ethics, depending on whether or not you consider the potential victims of your traps to be deserving of their fate.

items.name: Skill Proficiencies
items.entry: {@skill Perception}, plus your choice of one of the following: {@skill Arcana}, {@skill Investigation}, {@skill Sleight of Hand}, or {@skill Survival}.

items.name: Tool Proficiencies
items.entry: {@item Thieves' tools|phb}, {@item trapmaker's tools|TreTra}

items.name: Equipment
items.entry: A set of tough, rugged clothing, a set of {@item trapmaker's tools|TreTra}, a small boot knife, string, a wooden hammer, box of 50 1-inch iron nails, a small envelope holding 15 hollow needles, a thimble, a round leather {@item map or scroll case|phb|scroll case} containing 10 pieces of {@item parchment (one sheet)|phb|parchment}, 5 small pieces of writing charcoal, a spool of wire, a spool of thin braided rope, a spring, a pulley, and a {@item pouch|phb} containing 5 gp.

entries.name: Feature: Professional Courtesy
entries: When you come into contact with other trap makers with whom you share a language, you can talk shop. When you do this, you have a better chance of building professional rapport. At the GM's discretion, this might shift them away from being hostile, provide you a discount on materials, or they may decide to do you a small favor.

entries.name: Suggested Characteristics
entries: Being especially perceptive, you're always keeping a keen eye on your surroundings. Even in polite company, you're always looking for the nearest exit. You're rarely surprised since you have likely thought of many different ways a particular situation could go. You may also have some scars from your exploits, which you may or may not wear proudly.

rows: I'm persistent and don't give up easily.
It takes a lot to aggravate me but, once I reach that point, I explode like a powder keg.
I have a particular aversion to being confined in a space with no exit. My favourite places have no walls and no ceilings.
I'm trusting of those who seem genuine and always try to see the best in people.
I'm attracted to people with money and power.
I'm willing to risk everything for the sake of adventure.
I've regaled many a stunned crowd with stories of my adventures.
I'm especially sensitive, and resistant to criticism.
{@b Practical}. I use my skills to aid those with righteous intent. (Lawful)
{@b Reckless}. We may lose a few people along the way so the rewards better be worth it. (Chaotic)
{@b Supportive}. The coin I make from my skills goes to benefit the needy. (Good)
{@b Assignment}. It doesn't really matter who I'm working for, or to what end, as long as I get paid. (Neutral)
{@b Unpredictable}. People around me never know what I'm going to do next. (Chaotic)
Most of my earnings go to my guild.
I'm avoiding a manipulative and dependent family.
I regret putting my friend in a dangerous situation, one that led to their death.
Folk from far and wide will one day tell tales of my exploits.
I go it alone, and I always have.
I'm quick to make new friends, but also quick to lose them.
The desire to see what's beyond the horizon has gotten me in trouble more than once.
When I earn money I quickly, and foolishly, spend it.
It's every foolhardy adventurer for themselves when the plan goes sideways.
I have a loose relationship with the truth and will say whatever I need to if it's advantageous to me.
I am cowardly in the face of adversity.
I'm cheap and refuse to pay fair prices for goods and services.
I'm missing a digit or two.
I have a nasty scar on my face or head.
A section of my body has been horribly burned.
I don't have any eyebrows, and they never grow back.

_.displayName: round leather scroll case containing 10 pieces of parchment

skill.special: {@item smith's tools|phb}, {@item thieves' tools|phb}, {@item trapmaker's tools|TreTra}

trait.name: Channel Divinity (2/Short Rest)
entries: As an action, Berf can channel divinity ({@dc 14}) to create one of the following effects:

items.name: Turn Undead.
entries: Each undead that can see or hear Berf must make a Wisdom saving throw. If the creature fails its saving throw, it is turned for 1 minute, or until it takes damage.

A turned creature must spend its turns trying to move as far away from Berf as it can, and it can't willingly move to a space within 30 feet of him. It also can't take reactions. For its action, it can onyl use the {@action Dash} action, or try to escape from an effect that prevents it from moving. If there's nowhere to move, the creature can use the {@action Dodge} action.
When an undead fails its saving throw against Berf's Turn Undead feature, it is instantly destroyed if its CR is lower than 1.

items.name: Knowledge of the Ages.
entries: Berf gains proficiency in any skill, or with any tool, for 10 minutes.

items.name: Read Thoughts.
entries: Berf chooses one creature that he can see within 60 feet of him. That creature must make a Wisdom saving throw. If the creature succeeds on the saving throw, Berf can't use this feature on it again until he finishes a long rest.

If the creature fails its save, Berf can read its surface thoughts when it is within 60 feet of him. This effect lasts for 1 minute. During this time, Berf can use an action to end this effect and cast the {@spell suggestion} spell on the creature without expending a spell slot. The target automatically fails its saving throw against the spell.

trait.name: Dwarven Combat Training
entries: Berf has proficiency with {@item battleaxe|phb|battleaxes}, {@item handaxe|phb|handaxes}, {@item light hammer|phb|light hammers}, and {@item warhammer|phb|warhammers}.

trait.name: Dwarven Resilience
entries: Berf has advantage {@homebrew on} saving throws against poison.

trait.name: Stonecunning
entries: Whenever Berf makes an Intelligence ({@skill History}) check related to the origin of stonework, he is considered proficient in the {@skill History} skill, and has {@dice 1d20+9|+9} to his roll.

action.name: Mace
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d6+3}) bludgeoning damage, and 4 ({@dice 1d8}) radiant damage.

action.name: Light Crossbow
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 7} to hit, range 80/320 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d8+3}) piercing damage, and 4 ({@damage 1d8}) radiant damage.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: Berf is a 9th-level spellcaster. His spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save {@dc 14}, {@h 6} to hit with spell attacks). Berf has the following cleric spells prepared:

entries: {@b Class} Cleric 9
{@b Background} {@background Trapsmith|TreTra}
{@b Occupation} Hireling

entries.name: Overview
entries: Berf Barbender is an old dwarf cleric with a craggy, grizzled appearance; he wears a long, red waistcoat with big brass buttons. He is knowledgeable about religious artifacts, the locations where they might be stored, and the traps that might protect them. On his back, Berf carries a massive pack filled with a manner of trap detecting and disarming devices. He has the tools and skills to handle just about any type of trap, but even he will admit that he's not a master of any particular type; more of a generalist. Very few people know that he is a cleric; he keeps his holy symbol covered, and only reveals it in the most dire circumstances.

entries.name: Personality Traits
entries: Berf is persistent and doesn't give up easily. He nearly starved to death once when he delved into a trap-laden dungeon in search of a lost relic.

entries.name: Ideals
entries: Berf is a bit reckless at times; a few people may be lost along the way, but the rewards might be worth it.

entries.name: Bonds
entries: Berf regrets putting his former partner in a dangerous situation, one that lead to their death.

entries.name: Flaws
entries: The desire to see what's beyond the horizon has gotten Berf into trouble more than once.

entries.name: Roleplaying Berf
entries: Berf says what he thinks and lacks any {@homebrew subtlety|subtly} with his words. He is one of the toughest dwarves you'll ever encounter, with the stamina of someone half his age. He tries to make everyone around him think he doesn't get scared or feel pain but, deep down, even he has a breaking point.
{@b {@i "Don't touch a thing!"}}

entries.name: Equipment
entries: A set of tough, rugged clothing, a set of {@item trapmaker's tools|TreTra}, a small boot knife, string, a wooden hammer, box of 50 1-inch iron nails, a small envelope holding 15 hollow needles, a thimble, a round leather {@item map or scroll case|phb|scroll case} containing 10 pieces of {@item parchment (one sheet)|phb|parchment}, 5 small pieces of writing charcoal, a spool of wire, a spool of thin braided rope, a spring, a pulley, and a {@item pouch|phb} containing 5 gp.

skill.special: {@item thieves' tools|phb}, {@item tinker's tools|phb}, {@item trapmaker's tools|TreTra}

trait.name: Arcane Recovery (1/Day)
entries: When Izzy finishes a short rest, she can choose to expend spell slots to recover. The spell slots can have a combined level that is equal to or less than 7, and none of the slots can be 6th level or higher.

trait.name: Artificer's Lore
entries: Whenever Izzy makes an Intelligence ({@skill History}) check related to magic items, alchemical objects, or technological devices, she adds {@dice 1d20+5+15|+15} to her roll.

trait.name: Empowered Evocation
entries: Izzy can add her Intelligence modifier (+5) to one damage roll of any wizard evocation spell she casts.

trait.name: Gnome Cunning
entries: Izzy has advantage on all Intelligence, Wisdom, and Charisma saving throws against magic.

trait.name: Potent Cantrip
entries: Izzy's damaging cantrips affet even creatures that avoid the brunt of the effect. When a creature succeeds on a saving throw against her cantrip, the creature takes half the cantrip's damage (if any) but sufers no additional effect from the cantrip.

trait.name: Sculpt Spell
entries: Izzy can create pockets of relative safety within the effects of her evocation spells. When she casts an evocatoin spell that affects other creatures that she can see, she can choose a number of them equal to 1 + the spell's level. The chosen creatures automatically succeed on their saving throws against the spell, and they take no damage if they would normally take half damage on a successful save.

trait.name: Tinker
entries: Using her {@item tinker's tools|phb}, Izzy can spend 1 hour and 10 gp worth of materials to construct a Tiny clockwork device (AC 5, 1 hp). The device ceases to function after 24 hours (unless she spends 1 hour repairing it to keep the device functioning) or when she uses her action to dismantle it; at that time, she can reclaim the materials used to create it. She can have up to three such devices active at a time. When she creates a device, she chooses one of the following options:

items.name: Clockwork Toy.
entries: This toy is a clockwork animal, monster, or person, such as a frog, mouse, bird, dragon, or soldier. When placed on the ground, the toy moves 5 feet across the ground on each of Izzy's turns in a random direction. It makes noises appropriate to the creature it represents.

items.name: Fire Starter.
entries: The device produces a miniature flame, which Izzy can use to light a candle, torch, or campfire. Using the device requires her action.

items.name: Music Box
entries: When opened, this music box plays a single song at a moderate volume. The box stops playing when it reaches the song's end, or when it is closed.

action.name: Dagger
entries: {@atk mw,rw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. {@h}3 ({@damage 1d4 + 1}) piercing damage.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: Izzy is a 13th-level spellcaster. Her spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save {@dc 18}, {@h 10} to hit with spell attacks). Izzy has the following wizard spells prepared:

entries: {@b Class} Wizard 13
{@b Background} {@background Trapsmith|TreTra}
{@b Occupation} Hireling

entries.name: Overview
entries: Izzy Freeleaf is a 29-year-old gnome wizard, and an expert when it comes to identifying and overcoming magical traps. She takes great pride in her unique set of skills, as well as her ability to use magic to simply bypass traps in clever ways. She is tall and slender (for a gnome), with a rosy pink complexion and silvery-white hair. She wears fine clothing and rarely gets her hands dirty.

entries.name: Personality Traits
entries: If Izzy gets dirty (literally or figuratively), then she has done a poor job. Izzy works smart, not hard.

entries.name: Ideals
entries: Izzy strives for perfection and the best possible outcomes in all aspects of her life.

entries.name: Bonds
entries: Izzy does what she does because she loves the challenge and the feeling of accomplishment it gives her. The money is simply a necessity.

entries.name: Flaws
entries: When something goes wrong, Izzy immediately tries to assign blame, even fi it is with herself. She has a difficult time letting go of failure.

entries.name: Roleplaying Izzy
entries: Izzy is a somewhat frantic gnome who is obsessive about cleanliness and efficiency. Despite the manner in which she works, her spellcasting and her work with traps is perfect almost every time. She holds herself accountable for any failures, often to her detriment.
{@b {@i "Yes! That's the ticket!"}}

entries.name: Equipment
entries: {@item Component pouch|phb}, {@item spellbook|phb} (containing all the spells she has prepared, plus the following: {@spell arcane eye}, {@spell arcane lock}, {@spell fabricate}, and {@spell leomund's secret chest|phb|secret chest}), a set of tough, rugged clothing, a set of {@item trapmaker's tools|TreTra}, a small boot knife, string, a wooden hammer, box of 50 1-inch iron nails, a small envelope holding 15 hollow needles, a thimble, a round leather {@item map or scroll case|phb|scroll case} containing 10 pieces of {@item parchment (one sheet)|phb|parchment}, 5 small pieces of writing charcoal, a spool of wire, a spool of thin braided rope, a spring, a pulley, and a {@item pouch|phb} containing 5 gp.
{@footnote enhanced|No explanation of what this means is given.} {@item dungeoneer's pack|phb}

trait.name: Cunning Action
entries: Max can take a bonus action on each of his turns to take the {@action Dash}, {@action Disengage}, or {@action Hide} action.

trait.name: Fast Hands
entries: Max can use the bonus action granted by his Cunning Action to make a {@skill Sleight of Hand} check, use his {@item thieves' tools|phb} to disarm a trap or open a lock, or take the {@action Use an Object} action.

trait.name: Sneak Attack (1/Turn)
entries: Max can deal an extra 10 ({@damage 3d6}) damage to one creature he hits with an attack with a finesse or ranged weapon, if he has advantage on the attack roll. He doesn't need advantage on the attack roll if another enemy of the target is within 5 ft. of it, that enemy isn't {@condition incapacitated}, and he doesn't have disadvantage on the attack roll.

trait.name: Second Story Work
entries: Climbing no longer costs Max extra movement and, when he makes a running jump, the distance he covers increases by 4 feet.

trait.name: Thieves' Cant
entries: During his rogue training, Max learned {@language thieves' cant}, a secret mix of dialect, jargon, and code that allows him to hide messages in seemingly normal conversation. Only another creature that knows {@language thieves' cant} understands such messages. It takes four times longer to convey such a message than it does to speak the same idea plainly.

In addition, Max understands a set of secret signs and symbols used to convey short, simple messages, such as whether an area is dangerous, in the territory of a thieves' guild, loot is nearby, the people in an area are easy marks, or whether they will provide a safe house for thieves on the run.

action.name: Dagger
entries: {@atk mw,rw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d4+4}) piercing damage.

action.name: Shortsword
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d6+4}) piercing damage.

action.name: Shortbow
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 7} to hit, {@homebrew range} 80/320 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d6+4}) piercing damage.

reaction.name: Uncanny Dodge
entries: When an attacker that Max can see hits him with an attack, he can use his reaction to halve the attack's damage against him.
{@b Class} Rogue 5
{@b Background} {@background Trapsmith|TreTra}
{@b Occupation} Hireling

entries.name: Overview
entries: Max Rosewater is a 39-year-old human rogue with a focus on the detection, disarming and circumvention of non-magical traps. He's run into magical traps enough to know to look out for them, but he hasn't quite figured out good ways to deal with them. Though he may seem rough around the edges at first glance, he is actually quite the gentleman and highly respected in low places. He has a wiry build and wears his favorite leather armor which is tattered, but very comfortable.

entries.name: Personality Traits
entries: Max loves meeting new people and hearing about their lives. He's even got some tales of his own!

entries.name: Ideals
entries: Max is never too proud of anything. He'll work with anyone, so long as they do their part.

entries.name: Bonds
entries: Max once failed disarming a trap, which then got the entire team he was with killed. Max barely escaped, and has never fully been able to forgive himself.

entries.name: Flaws
entries: Max can be overly cautious, and sometimes take too long to do a thing. He gets irritated if he gets rushed.

entries.name: Roleplaying Izzy
entries: Max will take on almost any job he's offered. He is a sucker for tall tales and scintillating stories, and has plenty of his own to share. Despite this, he sometimes becomes melancholy while reflecting on his past. A tragedy killed many of his friends, and he holds himself to blame. This makes him extremely cautious while on the job.
{@b {@i "Steady now. Don't rush me..."}}

entries.name: Equipment
entries: A set of tough, rugged clothing, a set of {@item trapmaker's tools|TreTra}, a small boot knife, string, a wooden hammer, box of 50 1-inch iron nails, a small envelope holding 15 hollow needles, a thimble, a round leather {@item map or scroll case|phb|scroll case} containing 10 pieces of {@item parchment (one sheet)|phb|parchment}, 5 small pieces of writing charcoal, a spool of wire, a spool of thin braided rope, a spring, a pulley, and a {@item pouch|phb} containing 5 gp.

item.name: Trapmaker's Tools
entries: This kit includes tools handy for crafting traps, such as lightweight wire-cutters, pliers, various clips, and a pair of thick gloves designed for the handling of sharp objects.

variantrule.name: Disabling Spell Traps
entries: As an optional rule you can allow a character to use a successful Intelligence ({@skill Arcana}) check to disable a {@spell glyph of warding} or {@spell symbol} as well as {@spell dispel magic}. When we present {@footnote these kinds|This refers to {@filter magic traps|traphazards|source=TreTra|type=MAG} from this source.} of traps throughout, we assume that this optional rule is in effect.

trap.name: Stair Slide

items.name: Purpose:
items.entry: harm

entries: A 200-foot long, 10-foot wide staircase leads up from one floor to the next. 120 feet from the bottom of the stairs is a pressure plate that turns the stairs into a slide. Creatures on the stairs slide down and into the path of bolts fired from holes in the walls. Once they reach the bottom of the stairs, they are deposited into a pit.
trigger: {@b {@i (Weight Sensitive Surface).}} Two or more Medium or larger creatures standing on the steps past the 120-foot mark triggers the trap.
eActive: The Stair Slide is primarily a ramp depositing creatures in the pit at its bottom, but also has bolts that fire at creatures along the 120 feet from the trigger area to the trapdoor.

items.name: Stairs to Slide (Initiative 20).
items.entry: This element activates only once, the first time the trap acts. The stairs fold down, turning into a slide that is difficult terrain. Each creature on any portion of the stairs must succeed on a DC 10 Dexterity saving throw or fall {@condition prone}.

items.name: Open the Pit (Initiative 20).
items.entry: This element activates only once, the first time the trap acts. A trap door at the bottom landing of the stairs opens, revealing a 10-foot deep pit.

items.name: Hidden Bolts (Initiative 10).
items.entry: Bolts fire out from holes in the walls in the 120 feet between the trigger area and the trapdoor, making one attack against each creature in the area: {@hit 5} attack bonus; 2 ({@damage 1d4}) piercing damage on a hit.

eDynamic: A creature that starts its turn on the slide moves 30 feet down it, towards the pit. The distance the creature moves increases by 30 feet each time it starts its turn on the slide.
eConstant: Creatures are subjected to a shower of crossbow bolts while on the slide and drop into the pit when they hit the bottom.

items.name: Hail of Bolts.
items.entry: Any creature that ends its turn in the Hidden Bolts' area is targeted by a ranged attack: {@hit 5} attack bonus; taking 2 ({@damage 1d4}) piercing damage on a hit.

items.name: Into the Pit.
items.entry: A creature that reaches the bottom of the slide while {@condition prone} or moving faster than their base speed must succeed on a DC 10 Dexterity saving throw or fall into the pit, taking 3 ({@damage 1d6}) bludgeoning damage and landing {@condition prone}.

countermeasures: Creatures can avoid activating the Stair Slide and deal with these elements in a number of ways.

items.name: Trigger.
items.entry: A creature can spot the weight sensitive stairs that trigger the trap with a successful DC 10 Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) check. Once found, the trigger can be disabled with a successful DC 10 Dexterity check using {@item thieves' tools|phb}.

items.name: Stairs to Slide.
items.entry: A creature can try to make the slide revert back to stairs with a successful DC 10 Dexterity check using {@item thieves' tools|phb}.

items.name: Open the Pit.
items.entry: A creature can climb out of the pit with a successful DC 10 Strength ({@skill Athletics}) check. The trap doors can be closed with a successful DC 10 Strength check; the doors lock together. A creature that fails this check falls into the pit.

items.name: Hidden Bolts.
items.entry: Creatures who succeed on a DC 10 Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) check find the holes in a 5-foot section of wall from which the bolts fire. They can then plug these holes with cloth or something similar as an action. Plugging the holes prevents the bolts from firing in that area.

trap.name: Aging Offerings

items.name: Purpose:
items.entry: hinder

entries: Atop a shrine rests a copper bowl filled with gemstones.

entries.name: Trigger (Offering)
entries: A creature that removes the offerings from the bowl triggers the trap.

entries.name: Effect (Aging)
entries: A pulse of necromantic energy emanates from the bowl, aging the thief. The triggering creature must succeed on a DC 10 Constitution saving throw or be magically aged {@dice 1d10} years. If the roll is even, the creature is made younger; if odd, it becomes older. This forced aging can be undone with {@spell remove curse} or more powerful magic.

entries.name: Countermeasures
entries: A creature can infer the importance of the offerings with a successful DC 10 Intelligence (Religion) check, and {@spell detect magic} reveals an aura of necromancy on the bowl. Casting {@spell dispel magic} on the bowl disables the trap.
